19. Were you ever reduced to almost starvation level living on one or two locally produced foods? Give details. Yes.

My Brother Herbert Fischer had to eat plain boiled Wheat & Shot Bread for Meat in 1905. In the fall of 1905 my Mother who lived in Wpg. at that time, shipped them up a parcel for Xmas. They were so hungry they ate it all on the way home from town.

There was no school for me to attend at that time. No phones or neighbors near us.

22. Please add other details from your early experiences of buying groceries and securing foods in other ways during pioneer days in Western Canada. Include items not mentioned above, quality, methods of merchandising, prices, problems of storage, shortages and other details. [Use back of page if more space is needed].

We used to send to Eaton's in Winnipeg to buy what we thought was enough groceries to last all winter. In the Winter of 1906, snow was very deep, so we had to always carry a gun in the sleigh as there was lots of wild animals, coyotes, bears, lynxes, wolves, lynxes, wild cat. My brother shot a wild cat I brought it in the house. I have also helped my brother trap wolves, minks, muskrat, badger. I think I to stretch the pelts. I have also helped load the cartridges when empty. In the Winters of 1906-7 & 8, the trains used to get stuck in the snow drifts, so we used to put up the crew to supply food.
21. When did you begin to rely on purchased foods and prepared foods instead of home grown and home prepared foods? (Give as many details and dates as possible.)

22. Please add other details from your early experiences of buying groceries and regular foods in other ways during pioneer days in Newberry Township.

Include items not mentioned above, quality, methods of purchase, prices, problems of storage, shortages and other details. Use back of page if more space is needed.

In the winter of 1910-11, snow was very deep. I remember we always carried a gun in the building so there was no lack of wild game. We bought a Wild Goose from Mr. Graham. We also helped my parents hunt for Wild Goose. We brought it in the house. We also hunted for Woodchuck (Badger) and brought them to the cellar. We also hunted for Squirrel. We also hunted for Rabbit. We also hunted for Muskrat.

We bought the Cassells' goods when empty. We used to go to the winter of 1910-11. The Cassells used to sell us our supplies good.
